title: Syntax Demo Party 2007
content:
The prods from Syntax 2007, the Melbourne demo party that I ([img]http://images.szevvy.com/szsp.jpg[/img]) attended on the 21st of July, have been uploaded to Pout! It was a great party, and saw a surprising quantity and quality of releases. I strongly recommend checking them out. I contributed the one named Simple Life, under my Jimage alias. Watch that one too.

There were a bunch of oldschool prods as well (C64, Amiga, Vic20), but they don't seem to be added yet. If you have access to some emulators (or even the original hardware, though I don't know how many people on this forum would have the means for PC-Commodore data transfer), give them a whirl as well when they appear.

[url=http://www.pouet.net/party.php?which=1350&when=2007]See the demos here[/url]

[url=http://www.syntaxparty.org/]Syntax Demo Party Website[/url]

title: Re: Syntax Demo Party 2007
content:
Those demos are not bad. I'm not sure what was going on in Jimage's submission. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

The Dutch "jarig" one was weird, lol.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Syntax Demo Party 2007
content:
Hehe, very strange demo Spleen, neat! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Also, that 4K demo was cool. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
